bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of audio and videotapes of University events with materials from various University departments and offices. Series in the collection include: Presidents, Development, Alumni Affairs, Admissions, Dedications, Inaugurations, Colloquia, and several other categories. Materials include audiocassette recordings of 1988 Faculty Committee hearings; promotional videos for the Alumni Association, the Admissions department, and the Development department; video recordings of dinners, dances, and awards ceremonies; audio recordings of addresses by Bishop Fulton Sheen, Archbishop John F.
